Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-513.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 178.
Mr. Kim asked unanimous consent to consider the resolution.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development

official_title: Authorizing the use of the East Front of the Capitol Grounds for performances sponsored by the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

summary.text: Authorizes the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts to sponsor free public performances on the East Front of the Capitol grounds at such dates and times as the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Senate Committee on Rules and Administration jointly approve. Terminates this authority after FY 1998.

titles.title: Authorizing the use of the East Front of the Capitol Grounds for performances sponsored by the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.
